instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> touchbar 13 macbook has a short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>, I can't find the short, I removed SMC and hall sensor and other capacitor because they were getting hot, but I soldered them back because they were not shorted. I use an external power supply but all resistor and capacitor on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> line  gets quite hot, board absorbs 5A and voltage of external power supply goes obviously down to 0.9v.  what could it be? Any suggestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I cannot tell you what is shorted as it could be anything. Inject voltage and see what heats up. Also why put back stuff when the short has not been solved? There could be many things shorted, could even be inside the board. At 5A something must get pretty toasty.
